pullRequest.body:
Per the style guidelines, `λ` is disallowed in mathlib.
This is close to exhaustive; I left some tactic code alone when it seemed to me that tactic could be upstreamed soon.

Notes
- In lines I was modifying anyway, I also converted `=>` to `↦`.
- Also contains some mild in-passing indentation fixes in `Mathlib/Order/SupClosed`.
- Some doc comments still contained Lean 3 syntax `λ x, `, which I also replaced.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Drive-by question: is the Lean 3 syntax used in comments in `Data/FunLike/{Embedding,Equiv}` and `Data/Polynomial/Laurent` intended, or did somebody simply forget to fix this during the port?

I'll be happy to drop the changes to the `Lean/Meta` or `Tactic` directory, if I hear this is desired.
The style guide says "The lambda notation λ x ↦ x * x, while syntactically valid, is disallowed in mathlib in favor of the fun keyword.", which to me seems to include any mathlib tactics. (If this is not desired, this should be updated: happy to make a PR.)

Thanks a lot!

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8278834329/job/22652011171)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8278834329/job/22652010340)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8278834329/job/22652010731)

@dupuisf Thank you for the review!
Can you help me interpret your :+1: on my comment, please? Did you mean

- "I also had this question"
- "I think the syntax is intential"
- "I think somebody forgot about this; a PR is welcome"?
- something else?

As a mathematician, I have a hard time interpreting a "yes" answer to an "or" question :-)
Sorry for being cryptic :-) I meant that I agree that the Lean 3 syntax in the comments is almost certainly an artifact of the port and should have been converted to Lean 4 syntax.
Thanks for elaborating. I just looked into this; five PRs later, this has been fixed. #11405 and #11409 are particular off-spring.

I am pretty sure that we don't want any Lean 3 syntax anymore in the comments.
I am less sure whether we want to ban `λ` from meta-code.

I am pretty sure that we don't want any Lean 3 syntax anymore in the comments.
I am less sure whether we want to ban `λ` from meta-code.

```suggestion
instance [RatCast α] : RatCast (ULift α) := ⟨(up ·)⟩
```

```suggestion
instance natCast [NatCast α] : NatCast (ULift α) := ⟨(up ·)⟩
```

```suggestion
instance intCast [IntCast α] : IntCast (ULift α) := ⟨(up ·)⟩
```
and on line 185 use `(⟨·⟩)` (note that the parentheses are outside the anonymous constructor)

```suggestion
lemma Nat.tendsto_div_const_atTop {n : ℕ} (hn : n ≠ 0) : Tendsto (· / n) atTop atTop := by
```

```suggestion
  Eq.ndrec (motive := (· ⟶ v')) (Eq.ndrec e hv) hu
```
untested

```suggestion
  Eq.ndrec (motive := (Path · v')) (Eq.ndrec p hv) hu
```
Here, below and in `test/toAdditive` you have a whitespace too much (maybe somewhere else as well?)
Thanks; fixed (here and in all of mathlib). This means this PR has some drive-by space changes.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: replace `λ` by `fun`

nodes.body: Drive-by question: is the Lean 3 syntax used in comments in `Data/FunLike/{Embedding,Equiv}` and `Data/Polynomial/Laurent` intended, or did somebody simply forget to fix this during the port?

I am pretty sure that we don't want any Lean 3 syntax anymore in the comments.
I am less sure whether we want to ban `λ` from meta-code.

I'll be happy to drop the changes to the `Lean/Meta` or `Tactic` directory, if I hear this is desired.
The style guide says "The lambda notation λ x ↦ x * x, while syntactically valid, is disallowed in mathlib in favor of the fun keyword.", which to me seems to include any mathlib tactics. (If this is not desired, this should be updated: happy to make a PR.)

Thanks a lot!

@dupuisf Thank you for the review!
Can you help me interpret your :+1: on my comment, please? Did you mean

- "I also had this question"
- "I think the syntax is intential"
- "I think somebody forgot about this; a PR is welcome"?
- something else?

As a mathematician, I have a hard time interpreting a "yes" answer to an "or" question :-)
Sorry for being cryptic :-) I meant that I agree that the Lean 3 syntax in the comments is almost certainly an artifact of the port and should have been converted to Lean 4 syntax.
